item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, February 14, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Privacy Pass Authentication for Kagi Search (473 points | 174 comments)
2. The OBS Project is threatening Fedora Linux with legal action (74 points | 51 comments)
3. Phind 2: AI search with visual answers and multi-step reasoning (289 points | 109 comments)
4. We are the "thin blue line" that is trying to keep the code high quality (20 points | 4 comments)
5. MIT evolves virtual eye from scratch (30 points | discuss)
6. Doctor Droid (YC W23) Is Hiring a Back End Engineer ( | hide)
7. Show HN: SQL Noir – Learn SQL by solving crimes (112 points | 29 comments)
8. LM2: Large Memory Models (28 points | 6 comments)
9. MapTCHA, the open-source CAPTCHA that improves OpenStreetMap [video] (133 points | 19 comments)
10. Nvidia Security Team: “What if we just stopped using C?” (2022) (95 points | 33 comments)
11. Basis of the Kalman Filter [pdf] (142 points | 20 comments)
12. Open Source Software and Corporate Influence (19 points | 2 comments)
13. Who exactly needs to get approval from an institutional review board (IRB)? (187 points | 126 comments)
14. JesseSort: A novel sorting algorithm that is faster than Python's default sort. (46 points | 17 comments)
15. Fewer students are enrolling in doctoral degrees (118 points | 203 comments)
16. LibreOffice still kicking at 40, now with browser tricks and real-time collab (384 points | 152 comments)
17. OpenAI scrubs diversity commitment web page from its site (40 points | 3 comments)
18. MESI Cache Coherency Protocol Visualization (26 points | 1 comment)
19. SQL pipe syntax available in public preview in BigQuery (193 points | 96 comments)
20. How I built an AI company to save my open source project (3 points | discuss)
21. Feature Flags vs. Configuration Options – Same Difference? (8 points | discuss)
22. Self hosted FLOSS fitness/workout tracker (179 points | 93 comments)
23. Burning in woman's legs turned out to be slug parasites migrating to her brain (46 points | 33 comments)
24. Description Language for managing file/folder naming conventions (14 points | 4 comments)
25. Magnetic field sorting of superconducting graphite particles with Tc>400K (2024) (60 points | 33 comments)
26. WASM-Native Orchestration (71 points | 30 comments)
27. Learning fast and accurate absolute pitch judgment in adulthood (84 points | 41 comments)
28. The Human Alphabet (24 points | 10 comments)
29. Why Does Integer Addition Approximate Float Multiplication? (162 points | 64 comments)
30. Better text rendering in Chromium-based browsers on Windows (141 points | 112 comments)
